title: Facts About Variables
question_text: Which of the following statements about variables is NOT true?

choices.text: An individual can often be described with respect to many different variables.
Two different individuals can be measured or described on the same variable, but the value or description of the variable may not be the same for both individuals.
For one specific individual, the value of a quantitative variable may change over time but the value of a categorical variable will remain constant.
The individuals in a sample should all be the same with respect to the variable that makes them part of a population of interest.
Some types of variables can be considered either quantitative or categorical depending upon how they are described.
